TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PageResolution extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the page resolution of printed output as either a qualitative value or as dots per inch, or both.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service. Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution qualitative) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initiates a new instance of the class that has the specified .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 resolutionX, int32 resolutionY) cil managed

Docs.param: The horizontal resolution in dots per inch.
The vertical resolution in dots per inch.
Docs.summary: Initiates a new instance of the class that has the specified vertical and horizontal dots per inch.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For most printers, `resolutionX` is the paper dimension that is perpendicular to the direction of paper movement through the printer, and `resolutionY` is the paper dimension that is parallel to the direction of paper movement. The two values are usually the same.

MemberSignature.Value: public PageResolution (int resolutionX, int resolutionY, System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution qualitative);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 resolutionX, int32 resolutionY, valuetype System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution qualitative) cil managed

Docs.param: The horizontal resolution in dots per inch.
The vertical resolution in dots per inch.
Docs.summary: Initiates a new instance of the class that has the specified and the specified vertical and horizontal dots per inch.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For most printers, `resolutionX` is the paper dimension that is perpendicular to the direction of paper movement through the printer, and `resolutionY` is the paper dimension that is parallel to the direction of paper movement. The two values are usually the same.

Docs.summary: Gets the qualitative expression, if any, of the page resolution.
Docs.value: A value that represents the level of page resolution.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the page resolution as a <xref:System.String>.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> that contains the property values of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The format of the string is as follows:
<xref:System.Printing.PageResolution.X%2A> x <xref:System.Printing.PageResolution.Y%2A> (Qualitative Resolution: <xref:System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution>)

Docs.summary: Gets the dots-per-inch measure of the horizontal page resolution.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents a horizontal page resolution.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For most printers, this value is the paper dimension that is perpendicular to the direction of paper movement through the printer, and <xref:System.Printing.PageResolution.Y%2A> is the paper dimension that is parallel to the direction of paper movement. The two values are usually the same.

Docs.summary: Gets the dots-per-inch measure of the vertical page resolution.
Docs.value: A nullable <xref:System.Int32> value that represents a vertical page resolution.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For most printers, this value is the paper dimension that is parallel to the direction of paper movement through the printer, and <xref:System.Printing.PageResolution.X%2A> is the paper dimension that is perpendicular to the direction of paper movement. The two values are usually the same.
